title: "The Mesmeric Experiences of James Esdaile: A Revolutionary Figure in Surgical Practice"
first_phrase: This article discusses James Esdaile's mesmeric experiences and its impact on medical practice. He concluded that mesmerism was a natural power in the human body that affects the nervous and muscular systems. He discovered that chronic administration of mesmerism acted as a useful stimulant, and the mesmeric trance was a powerful remedy in local inflammations. Esdaile's successes were extraordinary, and he brought mesmerism to the forefront of surgical practice, earning honour and respect from the government and his peers. This last section focuses on his general conclusions and the importance of his mesmeric experiences, which are often underappreciated.
